abstract: NATO's plan to expand its role in migrant crisis by adding more patrols in Mediterranean region triggers dissent by some member nations pushing for more help against traditional threats like Russia; issue highlights larger debate within alliance about how it should engage with different parts of  world.
lead_paragraph: Beyond confronting Russia in the east, the alliance is facing an array of challenges on its southern flank, including terrorism and uncontrolled migration.

headline.main: Shifting Attention to Mediterranean, NATO Fights Internal Dissent
headline.print_headline: Turning to Mediterranean, NATO Faces Dissent

snippet: Beyond confronting Russia in the east, the alliance is facing an array of challenges on its southern flank, including terrorism and uncontrolled migration.
